Spears has been posting about her son Jayden more frequently since she reunited with him in December 2024.
“This is my baby,” she said in the video clip while giving him a huge kiss on the cheek.

Spears wrote, “Best Christmas of my life!!! I haven’t seen my boys in two years!!! Tears of joy and literally in shock everyday koo koo crazy so in love and blessed!!! I’m speechless thank you Jesus!!!”
Like his mom, Jayden seems to have musical talents. In 2022, Spears raved about him being a “genius." She shared a video of him playing the piano in April 2025 that demonstrates his impressive skill.
"My boys are so incredibly sweet and charming!!! I’m so blessed," she wrote in the caption.
On June 9, Spears shared a video of Jayden driving a convertible while she rides in the passenger seat. "Fly Away" by Lenny Kravitz plays in the background.
In the caption, Spears still seemed to amazed by her son.

"He is 6’3" and his hands are so big now!!!" she wrote. "How long am I going to be in shock??? It’s so incredibly crazy, it’s not even funny!!! I’m blessed!!! Just please be careful with my heart too!!"

title: The Special Meaning Behind Mariska Hargitay Premiering ‘My Mom Jayne’ at Carnegie Hall
summary: Mariska Hargitay's "My Mom Jayne" documentary had its debut event at Carnegie Hall, where she was surrounded by her kids, siblings and celebrity friends.
story: As the lights dimmed inside Carnegie Hall Friday night, Mariska Hargitay dazzled from her seat in the heart of the iconic venue as she took in the applause from the crowd.

The actor made her feature film directorial debut with “My Mom Jayne,” an HBO Original documentary about her mother, Jayne Mansfield, at New York City's historic concert hall as part of the Tribeca Festival.
Hargitay not only appears in the documentary, she also serves as director and producer, and she was surrounded by her family and friends on the big night.

Before the screening, she posed in a glamorous gown paired with a shimmering wrap and white gloves. In between interviews on the red carpet, she ran over to take photos with a rotation of loved ones, including her siblings, whom she interviewed for the film.

She also posed with celebrity pals, including Cher and Jamie Lee Curtis, as well as her “Law & Order” co-stars from over the years, including Christopher Meloni, Ice-T, Kelli Giddish and Peter Scanavino.
Scanavino told TODAY.com at the event that when he first saw a rough cut of the documentary, he was “just totally blown away” by the project.

“Years ago, she started talking about it, but there’s always things — when you deal with something like her mother, you don’t want to pry,” he said. “I always got the sense that it was kind of a very somewhat private thing for her.”
Curtis, who's been open about her love for her new friend Hargitay, was equally as supportive of Hargitay's personal project.

“I think any time we can see women step up and out and into the light of their truth, and do it with grace and humor and love and beauty, that’s a message that I think does translate,” Curtis told TODAY.com at the premiere event.
“She’s been carrying her family story for a long time, and it’s time for her to shed it in this gorgeous documentary and now step free as an artist,” she added. “Now we have a filmmaker.”
Hargitay said she was “very afraid” to make the film during a Q&A moderated by Griffin Dunne after the screening of the documentary.

“Learning to lean into the sharp edges and tolerate the uncomfortable feelings and sort of breathe through it, and then coming out the other side to this gorgeous support, these beautiful humans, all these people that were just trying to do the best that they can, and they did,” she said. “I look at it now, and I’m so grateful for the choices that were made for me.”

In the film, Hargitay opens up about the moment in her 20s when she learned her biological father was not Mickey Hargitay, who raised her, but an Italian singer named Nelson Sardelli, whom Mansfield had an affair with in the process of divorcing Mickey Hargitay.
Mariska Hargitay met Sardelli when she was 30 but continued to keep the secret about her parentage until now.
At the Carnegie Hall Q&A, she expressed her gratitude for being able to be the one to share her journey about such a delicate topic in her own time.
“But what I find so amazing is that this story has not gone out there, and it was mine to tell,” she said.
One constant in the film is Mansfield’s love of music. The 1950s Hollywood starlet played piano and the violin, including in some of her television appearances, like on “The Ed Sullivan Show.”

At one point in the archival footage, Mansfield says she one day hopes to play at Carnegie Hall. While this dream never came to fruition before her death at 34 after a car accident, the crowd at Carnegie Hall June 13 erupted into applause for Mansfield and her legacy, told through the eyes of her daughter.
Hargitay described the access to archival materials about her mom as “a gift from God.”

“And forget this filmmaker, director, or editor, producer, just as a person, as a little girl looking for their mother, and then I just got all this footage of all these moments of her speaking … and not playing the role,” she said to the crowd. “And that was what I wanted. That’s what I was after.”
Hargitay said she “went into the movie truly not liking the sound of my mother’s voice.” Mansfield was known for her breathy, higher-pitched voice in her on-camera appearances.

“Even in the beginning, listening to it, I was like, cringe,” Hargitay explained. “And then as the movie went on, and I got to hear her real voice. And tonight, as I was getting ready, I was playing her music and listening to songs that I had heard before. And everything has been reframed.”
“My Mom Jayne” will air June 27 on HBO at 8 p.m. ET and stream on HBO Max.

title: Jenna and Leslie Bibb Discuss the Shared Date Night Code Word They Use With Their Partners
summary: Jenna Bush Hager and Leslie Bibb revealed on TODAY with Jenna & Friends on June 16 that they share the same date night "safe word" that they use with their partners when they're trying to exit an event in a subtle way.
story: When it comes to social outings and double dates that last a little too long, Jenna Bush Hager and Leslie Bibb have the perfect trick.

The topic came up during the June 16 episode of TODAY with Jenna & Friends, while Jenna and her guest co-host were discussing Brad Pitt and Bradley Cooper's recent double date with their significant others.
"Do you like a double date?" Bibb asked Jenna.
"I like a double date with people that are like family. What about you?" Jenna responded.
Bibb said she does enjoy a double date but sometimes worries if they'll go well when she and her partner, Sam Rockwell, are venturing out with a new couple.
"And then you never know because then sometimes it can be like you need a safe word to get out of it," the actor explained.
Jenna then revealed that she and Bibb, as well as their significant others, share the same "safe word" for getting out of a social event.
"Coconut," Bibb said, adding that she and Rockwell also use the word "Oklahoma" to signal to each other that they're ready to leave an event.
"Mine is just 'coconut,' but I cant believe we have that (same word)," Jenna said.
Bibb went on to clarify that she and Rockwell don't just use their safe word to "get out of things," and Jenna agreed.
"No, we're saying like if we're at a party and we're exhausted, I'll be like, 'Henry, coconut.' And most of the time he's like, 'You want a drink?'" she said of her husband, Henry Hager.
"Coconut margarita!" Bibb chimed in.
"He doesn't quite understand," Jenna said.
"Oh my God, he's such an angel," Bibb replied.
The "White Lotus" star returned to Studio 1A on June 16 to co-host TODAY with Jenna & Friends after appearing on the show in March when Henry was co-hosting.
During Bibb's appearance, Jenna asked her about her bob haircut, calling it a "cultural moment."
"I did a little thing in the mirror where I'm like, 'I'm getting a bob,'" Jenna said. "I'm getting a bob based only on you."
"I think you should," Bibb replied.
When the actor returned to co-host the show on June 16, Jenna actually went through with the idea and enlisted the help of celebrity hairstylist Chris McMillan to make it happen.
At the end of the show, Jenna teased that the results would be unveiled the next day when Bibb returns to co-host once again.
"Thank God, because I'm going to need her," Jenna joked.

title: Eric Braeden Recalls the 1 Moment He Knew He'd Stick With 'The Young and the Restless' Long Term
summary: Eric Braeden talks in an interview with TODAY.com about his wife, son, co-stars and 45 years on "The Young and the Restless" as Victor Newman.
story: Eric Braeden has a break in between filming scenes for "The Young and The Restless," and he's waiting for me in his dressing room.

It's the third time we've spoken over the last two years and the first time we've met in person. As a lifelong fan of the CBS daytime drama, I'm excited to finally come face to face with the man who has played business tycoon Victor Newman for the last 45 years.
On "Y&R," Braeden's character is known for his ardent family values and ruthless business moves: a rare combination that sometimes puts him in compromising positions.
In person, Braeden certainly has a commanding presence at just over 6 feet tall, but he also possesses a warm, playful nature that has won the hearts of countless fans and colleagues alike.
Case in point? Braeden greets me at the door of his dressing room by pretending to peek outside the door and hide for a second. Then he gives me a big hug.
After talking about my flight to California, Braeden and I chat for a few moments before diving into the matter at hand: a conversation about his 45th anniversary on "Y&R."
When I ask how he celebrated such a colossal milestone back in February, the 84-year-old has a simple response.

"I personally don’t celebrate much. You just sit back and you allow yourself to say, 'Whoa, that’s a long time.' I'm not someone who rests on laurels. I don’t do that," he explains. "I’m always future oriented. I'm always (asking), 'What's next? Let's go.'"
It's a mentality that has served Braeden well throughout his decades-long career in Hollywood and one that helped him cope with the loss of his house amid the California wildfires earlier this year.
“I don’t allow myself to think about that too much because I have known people who then get dragged down by it," he says.
Braeden and his wife of nearly 60 years, Dale Russell Gudegast, have found a "semi-permanent place" to live as they sort out plans to rebuild their home.
For Braeden, having something to look forward to helps keep him motivated.
"The solution lies in action, in doing," he says.

Braeden, who was born Hans Jörg Gudegast and grew up in Germany, is certainly a doer. At the age of 18, he moved from Germany to the U.S. and worked a variety of jobs before stumbling into the entertainment industry.
Now, his acting credits run the gamut of film, theater and TV, including roles in "Titanic," "The Rat Patrol," "Colossus: The Forbin Project" and countless others.
While building his career, Braeden once visited the set of a soap opera but didn't give the medium much thought again until he later got the opportunity to take on the role of Victor Newman in 1980.
Ironically, the actor was never supposed to stay at “Y&R” very long. But as he settled into the temporary role, fans grew to love Victor, and Braeden was offered a long-term contract.
The only problem? Braeden wasn't sold on the character. So he spoke to his wife, who encouraged him to look at the role as a challenge. Then, he sat down with Bill Bell, the co-creator of "Y&R."

"I said, 'Bill, I’m tired of playing only bad guys. I’ve done that for so many years, on nighttime television, films.' I said, 'Can we attribute a background to this character that explains why he is who he is?' Because we all are formed by it. And he came up with the storyline where I tell Nikki (Newman) that I grew up in an orphanage. I then knew I would stay," he recalls.

Braeden's character has been at the center of a plethora of captivating storylines over the years, but he's particularly fond of one that featured Dorothy McGuire and George Kennedy playing his on-screen mother and father.

"All of that creates the bedrock for what Victor Newman became, and that was the brilliance of Bill Bell, who came up with that storyline," Braeden says. "Those are by far, hands down, the most seminal scenes I’ve done in the show explaining who Victor Newman is."
Victor has had many romantic interests over the course of 45 years, but none compare to his epic love story with Nikki Newman (Melody Thomas Scott).
"The reason Mel and I have been doing it so long is because she gets me. Mel knows how to deal with me. ... And I with her," he says while complimenting his "clever" and talented co-star.
As the head of Newman Enterprises, Victor is known as a master manipulator in the world of business. But in real life, Braeden says he doesn't possess the same penchant for corporate subterfuge.
“Obviously, I don’t do anything that Victor does. I’m not a business guy,” he says, noting that he does have a few things in common with his character.
For instance, Victor never shies away from a fight, and Braeden shares the same signature tenacity.
“When it comes to confrontation, I don’t back down. I don’t give a f--- who it is. I don’t back down. And that has been the case with me since I was a young boy,” he says.
Victor is known for meddling in his family’s affairs, especially their romantic escapades. But Braeden takes a more even-keeled approach.
"I love my family and would never dictate to my family," he says.
Speaking of family, Braeden lights up when I bring up his son, Christian Gudegast, whom he refers to as his “greatest accomplishment” in his book, “I’ll Be Damned.”
In a way, Gudegast has followed in his father's footsteps, pursuing a career as a writer and director.

"I always sort of wanted him to become an actor. And only about half a year ago, he told me why he didn’t want it. Because he saw me at certain times in my life very upset about not getting this or that role,” he explains.
Braeden sent his son to acting school to give him a solid foundation as a director and has supported his dreams ever since.

Braeden's passion for his craft is evident as he recounts his iconic career. Although he had many notable acting credits to his name before joining the cast of "Y&R," he tells me that the soap opera taught him something invaluable about the significance of an actor's work.

“One of the most profound meanings is to entertain people. I learned that here in this medium and I’m very grateful," he says. "I’m very grateful to fans for that reason because they taught me what this is about — entertainment," he says.
While talking about the volume of work he and his colleagues produce on a weekly basis, the soap opera veteran's pride is evident.

"I think it’s the toughest medium there is in Hollywood. I’ve done it all," he says. "For writers, this is the hardest job in all of Hollywood, writing for a soap. As an actor, it is equally much the hardest job there is."
Braeden goes on to describe just how much work goes into filming a soap opera.
"In film, we do two or three pages a day," he explains.

On the opposite end of the spectrum, Braeden says soap operas typically shoot 100 pages of dialogue a day. As a main star of the show, he's certainly in demand and has a record of shooting 62 pages of dialogue in one day.
I get to witness Braeden in action filming scenes for an upcoming episode, and it's easy to see why he's so respected by his colleagues.
The industry veteran handles his lines with ease and also imbues a sense of fun into his work, chatting animatedly with his co-stars and the crew.
While reading Braeden's autobiography, I was intrigued by a passage where he discusses a quote from playwright and screenwriter Tennessee Williams, who defined happiness as "insensitivity."

After losing his father at the age of 12 and navigating poverty at a young age, I'm curious to know if Braeden's worldview was shaped by these formative experiences and how he himself defines happiness.

“There’s no such thing in and of itself. It’s nonsense. It’s b-------.  (Happiness is) in the doing, and it’s in the few moments after the doing that you feel, ‘Well, I accomplished something. Great.’ That’s it. A few minutes afterwards, then you’ve got to plan another thing to do. There’s no permanent happiness state,” he explains.
The answer is consistent with the way Braeden has progressed in his career: constantly on the move, consistently challenging himself.

The actor shows no signs of slowing down, and I can't help but selfishly wonder if he will ever leave "Y&R" to enjoy a proper retirement. Luckily for me and countless other fans, he has no plans of stepping away from his career anytime soon.
“I love doing what I’m doing. I love doing it. I don’t know why, but I do,” he says.

title: Justin Timberlake Shares a Rare Photo of His Sons With a Special Message
summary: Justin Timberlake has two sons with Jessica Biel, Silas and Phineas. He shared a rare photo of them on Father's Day with a sweet message.
story: Justin Timberlake has won 10 Grammy Awards and sold millions of albums, but he says nothing tops being a parent.

“There’s no bigger reward or responsibility that I have ever felt in my life above being a father. To teach and to learn at the same time... I feel beyond blessed," Timberlake began a June 15 Instagram post. In the accompanying photo, Timberlake cradles his younger son, Phineas, 4, as his older son, Silas, 10, wraps his arms around them.

“I see my two dads, my grandfathers, my uncles more and more clearly every year that I get to experience this life with them,” he wrote. “And I see myself more clearly in every moment I have with my sons, watching who they continue to become.”
“You can’t put a price tag on that type of generational wealth!” Timberlake, 44, added.
Jessica Biel, Timberlake’s wife and the mother of their two children, also shared a tribute, calling him “the best dad out there.”

In a recent conversation with InStyle, Biel, an actor, reflected on the importance of having a strong support system while raising children “in a wild business like this, where parents are traveling for long times for work.”
The “7th Heaven” alum, 43, credited her “chosen sisters” and her “best friend,” Timberlake, for helping her navigate it all.
“I don’t know how I would have survived life without them,” Biel told the publication.

Both Biel and Timberlake have remained committed to keeping their boys out of the spotlight, but last summer, the couple made a rare exception, allowing Silas to be photographed at the 2024 U.S. Open Tennis Championship.

“He’s a huge tennis fan — that’s his sport, that’s what he plays. We had this opportunity, and we talked about it. We talked about photographers. You know, ‘Are you comfortable with that?’ He can’t make decisions on his own, but at this point, we can at least discuss what’s his opinion around it,” Biel said.
Speaking to InStyle, Biel said she wasn’t sure if allowing the picture was the right the decision.
“It’s scary every time," she said. "But it’s also their life. And so it’s this really tricky, tricky thing to figure out.”

title: Justin Bieber Shares Lengthy Instagram Post About ‘Anger Issues’: ‘I Know I’m Broken’
summary: Justin Bieber shared a message to his followers saying he knows he's "broken" one day after Father's Day
story: Justin Bieber shared a message to his followers saying he knows he's "broken" one day after Father's Day.
The singer posted on Instagram June 16, writing that he knows he has anger issues and that he "tried to do the work" his entire life to be more like people who told him he needed to be "fixed."
"People keep telling me to heal," Bieber wrote. "Don't you think if I could have fixed myself I would have already?"

"I know I'm broken. I know I have anger issues," he continued. "I tried to do the work my whole life to be like the people who told me I needed to be fixed like them. And it just keeps making me more tired and angry."
Bieber, 31, added the harder he tries to grow, the more focused on himself he becomes.
"Jesus is the only person who keeps me wanting to make my life about others," he said. "Because honestly I'm exhausted with learning about myself lately aren't you?"
Bieber captioned the post with a middle finger emoji, which he also used to caption most of his 18 Instagram posts he published on Sunday, June 15.
Some of the Sunday posts included photos of his son, Jack, and wife, Hailey Bieber, with some showing the pair playing piano together, and another of Jack's hand with a bracelet on it.
Other posts included pictures of Bieber's feet as he laid on the floor, and close ups of his face, including his first Father's Day post, which he captioned: "I’m a dad that’s not to be f----- with."
Justin and Hailey Bieber announced the birth of their first child in August after sharing they were expecting in May 2024.
“WELCOME HOME,” Justin Bieber captioned an Instagram post on Aug. 23, before sharing the baby’s name. “JACK BLUES BIEBER.”
Since Jack's birth, Justin Bieber has shared snippets into his life as a dad, including a carousel of photos posted in January showing him and his wife enjoying time outside in the snow.
In one photo, he's seen carrying Jack in a baby harness on his chest, though only the back of the baby's head is visible.

title: Rebel Wilson Reveals Wife Ramona Has Cameo in Her New Film 'Bride Hard'
summary: Rebel Wilson didn't have to look far when they needed someone to fill a small role in her new comedy action film, "Bride Hard."
story: Rebel Wilson didn't have to look far when they needed someone to fill a small role in her new comedy action film, "Bride Hard."
Wilson's wife, fashion designer Ramona Agruma, makes her big-screen debut with a cameo in the upcoming movie, where Wilson plays a secret agent who is also the maid of honor at her friend's wedding.
Wilson wasn't the first one who wanted to get Agruma on screen, as the "Real Housewives" franchise made an entreaty to her before her small role in "Bride Hard," which hits theaters on June 20.
"She was actually offered, but she has no desire to be in the spotlight," Wilson told Savannah Guthrie on June 16 on TODAY.

"But weirdly she has a cameo in 'Bride Hard' because they needed somebody to speak Russian to play a Russian scientist," she continued. "And so Ramona’s like, ‘Yeah, all right.’ She just stepped in. She’s not an actress, but she just came in and crushed it. I was like, ‘Babe, you’re actually good.’"
Agruma was raised in Latvia and speaks multiple languages, including German and Russian.

In addition to her wife's cameo, Wilson survived a wild moment during the filming of an action scene in the movie. She said she had her "nose slashed open" on the last night of shooting and had to get plastic surgery.
"It was hardcore," she said.

The couple tied the knot in September 2024 at a ceremony in Sardinia, Italy.  Agruma, who’s the founder of the Los Angeles-based clothing brand Lemon Ve Limon, had been dating Wilson for two years. The two announced their engagement in February 2023.
They also are parents of Wilson's daughter, Royce Lillian Elizabeth Wilson, who was born via surrogate on Nov. 7, 2023.

title: 'Sister Wives': Meri Brown Debunks Rumors that She Introduced Kody to Robyn
summary: Meri Brown wants "Sister Wives" viewers to know one important thing about Kody and Robyn Brown's meet-cute
story: Meri Brown wants "Sister Wives" viewers to know one important thing about Kody and Robyn Brown's meet-cute.
In a the last "Sister Wives: One on One" special of Season 19, the reality star sets the record straight about how Kody and Robyn Brown really met.
The topic comes up when host Sukanya Krishnan asks if Meri Brown has "any regrets" about introducing the couple.
"I didn’t introduce Robyn to Kody," she replies.
"You didn’t?" Krishnan asks in shock.
"No. There’s this whole big thing out there on the Twittersphere right now that I introduced them. I did not introduce them," the reality star says.
Meri Brown was the first of Kody Brown's four wives. In recent years, Christine Brown Woolley and Janelle Brown have also left the father of 18, leaving him with one remaining wife, Robyn Brown.
While speaking with Krishnan, Meri Brown clarifies that she and her husband were indeed together when they met Robyn Brown for the first time.

"So we’re driving down the road, and our neighbors, our friends, they were all outside talking. So we stopped to say hi to our friends. He was talking to (Robyn's) cousin’s husband and she and I kind of started talking and we just kind of felt this connection," she explains.
In his own interview with Krishnan, Kody Brown adds to the story, saying, "Meri made a connection with Robyn, and Robyn and I were kind of avoiding contact with each other."
Kody Brown goes on to say he was "fishing" for information about Robyn Brown's relationship status when he first started talking to her.
"I mean, Meri's right there and besides, I was a little embarrassed cause I didn't let go (of eye contact) the first time (I'd seen Robyn before that)," he says.
This was actually the second time Kody Brown had laid eyes on his future wife, according to the episode. The first occurred at church.
"I see her sitting there and I figure, 'OK, she’s got to be about 28 or 30. And she's by herself. And I made eye contact with her and I couldn’t look away," he recalls later during the interview.
The couple didn't end up talking that first time around, but they shared a powerful gaze.
"Finally she looks away and I’m like, 'Oh.' I kind of woke up from a trance," Kody Brown says.
After Kody and Robyn Brown shared their first actual conversation, Meri Brown encouraged her husband to look into her, describing her as "cute."
From there, Meri, Christine and Kody Brown attended a dance together where Robyn Brown was in attendance.
"Christine had gone home early and it was nearly the last dance. And Meri’s like, 'You should go ask Robyn to dance,'" he recalls.
When he stepped on the dance floor with Robyn Brown, Kody Brown said it became a "serendipitously beautiful" experience.

"It’s like all of a sudden there’s nobody but us on the dance floor. And I’m talking to her like we’ve known each other our whole lives. (It was) the kind of safety combined with just the depth of connections. She was very vulnerable. And I was at the time. There was a depth of connection that I do not believe I have ever had," he says.
When asked if he had a similar moment with his other wives, Kody Brown says, "Not that I recall."
"It was more of like a pragmatic thought process," he says.

title: Kody Brown Shuts Down 'Sister Wives' Interview For 'Crossing the Line'
summary: Kody Brown was upset when a Sister Wives interview focused on his sexuality. Here's what he said and how he shut it down.
story: Kody Brown grows increasingly agitated during a conversation about his sexual relationship with one of his wives in the final “Sister Wives: One on One” special of Season 19.
The topic comes up when host Sukanya Krishnan plays a clip of the reality star talking about a “sexual experience” he had in college that went against his “religious values.”
Later on, she asks if Kody Brown had “any other sexual experiences” before he met Meri Brown, his first wife.
The father of 18 laughs as he says, “There were other options that got close.”
Kody Brown goes on to describe himself as “Mormon naughty” in high school.
“What does ‘Mormon naughty’ mean?” Krishnan then asks.
“It means I would kiss and hug, but no actual intercourse,” he explains.
Krishnan then uses sports terms to relate to the reality star, who played football in school. “So you never got the touchdown, but you got some picks,” she says.
Kody Brown laughs awkwardly in response and says, “You know, out of respect for my wife, I’m going to quit discussing this with you. You guys can act like it’s the world’s business all you want.”
“We’re just having some fun,” Krishnan notes.
“No, we just crossed a line, so it’s done,” he says, still smirking.

The scene then shifts to Christine Brown Woolley, one of Kody Brown’s three ex-wives, who suggests that Kody and Robyn Brown may have been sexually intimate before marriage despite their claims otherwise.
“We’ve all seen their engagement photos and I just automatically think, ‘Huh.’ I wonder how close they got before they were married,” she says.

Robyn Brown then addresses the situation in her own interview with Krishnan, saying, “He didn’t kiss me until he asked me to marry him. And it wasn’t a kiss. It was a stamp. You know, his face smashed mine. That was it. You know, it wasn’t anything super sexy.”
When Krishnan pushes the topic, bringing up Christine Brown Woolley’s speculations, Robyn Brown says she and Kody Brown only shared “little church kisses” before their wedding.
“Something you can do in front of your pastor or your bishop,” she says.
The scene returns to Kody Brown and Krishnan, who says she “loved our conversation about Mormon naughtiness.” Kody Brown then shuts down.
“No, we’re not talking about my sexuality. No, come on. That was, crossing the line.
“No, it was not about your sexuality. It’s about you and Robyn,” Krishnan clarifies.
“That was not a cool discussion,” he says as he shifts in his seat.
The reality star then explains why he’s so annoyed.
“I give a little bit here and it’s like, I give an inch. I’m generous. And it’s like, ‘Well, let’s dig into his life.’ I didn’t think that was cool,” he says.
While appearing on an episode of “The Sarah Fraser Show,” Krishnan recently addressed another moment during their interview that led Kody Brown to stare at her in silence.
“The stare down is pretty awesome. When it was happening, I was like, ‘Is he not talking?’ I was in my head. I was like, ‘Is he just not going to talk to me?’” she said.
Krishnan elaborated on the matter, saying, “It went on for about a minute 30. Think about staring at somebody for a minute 30 dead in their eyes.”

title: Are Shannon and Earl Together After ‘Bravo’s Love Hotel’? Why It’s ‘Hard’ for Her to Watch Now
summary: Shannon Storms Beador tells TODAY.com in an interview if she's together now romantically with Earl Thompson after connecting on "Bravo's Love Hotel."
story: From the beginning on “Bravo’s Love Hotel,” Shannon Storms Beador had her sights set on one man, but did their love story continue outside of the hotel?

The “Real Housewives of Orange County” star struck up a romance on the show in Los Cabos, Mexico, with Earl Thompson from Lawrenceville, Georgia. She even helped Earl get contact information for his estranged stepson, with assistance from her attorney back home.

Shannon, whose previous marriage to David Beador played out over the years on “RHOC,” says the No. 1 thing that attracted her to Earl was his “kind eyes” and the eye contact he maintained. “He was engaged in a conversation,” she tells TODAY.com. “I need to be a priority. I don’t feel like I’ve been a priority in any of the relationships that I’ve been in, and so, that’s my hope.”

Earl was previously married twice and lost one of his wives to leukemia, which is one of the first things he told Shannon when they met. While Shannon and Earl had many sweet moments together, they also had their share of disagreements.

Shannon initially got upset when Earl didn’t comfort her on a particularly emotional night for her: the one-year anniversary of her DUI arrest. A few episodes later, Earl was not happy with Shannon for choosing to go out with her “Love Hotel” castmates, Luann de Lesseps, Ashley Darby and Gizelle Bryant, instead of being there for him as he stressed over the path of a hurricane headed toward his Florida and Georgia homes.
“I did have a few hiccups with Earl,” Shannon says, “but there’s something about him that when we were together and things were good, it was really good.”
Despite her ups and downs with Earl in Mexico, she says she was “easily sucked back in” after filming for the show ended.
“After the show, we did — we talked every day,” she says. “I went and stayed with him in Georgia. He came out to Orange County, but in the end, it didn’t work out.”
“We have very different personalities, in the long run,” she explains. “And we were in a bubble there, but I wish it would’ve been different. But it is what it is.”
“It’s sad for me,” she says. “I’ll be honest with you, it’s hard to watch the show right now because I remember that I cared about him, and so it’s hard.”
Shannon says she has no interest in dating at this time because she does not want to get hurt again.
“I know that when I watch a show, and I’m invested in certain people, I want them to stay together,” she says. “So it was important for me to try my hardest to make it work.”

As for what she’s looking for in a partner, Shannon, who also describes herself as “a relationship girl,” says she, most importantly, wants someone with “a kind heart,” adding that looks are “not that important.”
“I want someone that’s intelligent and that has a sense of humor, because I like to learn from people,” she says.

“I didn’t think that I would be OK on my own, but now that I have been, I kind of like it,” Shannon, who says she does not use dating apps, explains. After her marriage ended, she began dating John Janssen in 2019, and the two very publicly broke up in 2022. Janssen has since moved on with “RHOC” alum Alexis Bellino.

“In my perfect world, I would meet someone who is confident, successful and thinks it’s really cute that I’m on this silly show and doesn’t want to be a part of it. Because that’s a really hard thing when you’ve been doing it for as long as we have, that, you know, does someone want to be famous or not?” Shannon says.
“That’s what happened in my last relationship,” she adds. “He wanted to be, and I didn’t think he did.”

title: George, Charlotte and Louis Wish Prince William Happy Father's Day With ‘Before and After’ Pics
summary: Princes George and Louis and Princess Charlotte took over their parents' Instagram page to share a special message for dad William, Prince of Wales.“Happy Father’s Day, Papa (before and after!) We love you!
story: Princes George and Louis and Princess Charlotte took over their parents' Instagram page to share a special message for dad William, Prince of Wales.
“Happy Father’s Day, Papa (before and after!) We love you! G, C & L,” the young royals said in an Instagram post June 15, signed with their initials.
The post features two new photos of Prince William with his children. In the “before” photo, the siblings smiled and stood beside their dad, with Charlotte hugging tight to younger brother Louis.

The “after” image was seemingly taken after their photoshoot and saw George, Charlotte and Louis piling on top of their dad in the grass. Charlotte looked directly at the camera in the black-and-white image, appearing to be mid-laugh.
The Father's Day post comes just one day after the family attended the annual Trooping the Colour ceremony, traditionally held to honor the king's birthday, on June 14.
Charlotte twinned in bright blue with mom Catherine, Princess of Wales, who made a joyful appearance at the event, her first time at the parade since announcing she's in remission from cancer.

Louis, who turned 7 in April, historically charms the world with his facial expressions and antics at the event. This year, Louis again seemed to delight onlookers, as well as King Charles III and Queen Camilla.

The royal family celebrated Mother’s Day in the United Kingdom on March 30. The former Kate Middleton personally marked the occasion with a dedication to Mother Nature, writing, “Over the past year, nature has been our sanctuary.”
Kate announced her cancer diagnosis in March 2024 and shared news of her remission in January 2025.

“This Mother’s Day, let us celebrate Mother Nature and recognise how our bond with the natural world can help not only nurture our inner selves, but remind us too of the role we play within the rich tapestry of life,” she said on Instagram before signing off, C.

title: Jamie Lee Curtis Reveals the Hilarious Catchphrase She Shares with Mariska Hargitay
summary: Jamie Lee Curtis tells TODAY.com in an interview at the "My Mom Jayne" premiere about her friendship with Mariska Hargitay and the one phrase they both love.
story: Some of the best friendships come along later in life — just ask Jamie Lee Curtis, who over the past few years, discovered her “secret sister,” Mariska Hargitay.
The Oscar winner supported her friend June 13 at Hargitay’s Tribeca Festival premiere for “My Mom Jayne,” a documentary about the “Law & Order: SVU” star’s mother, Jayne Mansfield.
Curtis couldn’t be prouder of Hargitay for not only sharing Mansfield’s story, but also making her film directorial debut with the HBO Original project.

“She’s been carrying her family story for a long time, and it’s time for her to shed it in this gorgeous documentary and now step free as an artist,” Curtis said in an interview with TODAY.com at the event. “Now we have a filmmaker.”

Curtis often elevates women in the entertainment industry on her social media accounts, from hyping up her “The Last Showgirl” co-star Pamela Anderson to showing support for her longtime pal Jodie Foster.
“I think any time we can see women step up and out and into the light of their truth, and do it with grace and humor and love and beauty, that’s a message that I think does translate,” Curtis said.
Curtis and Hargitay began hanging out in recent years and documented their blossoming friendship on social media.
“Fierce female friendship alert. Love this lady. #WhereYouBeenAllMyLife#SisterFromAnotherMister🤝,” Hargitay captioned a photo of herself with Curtis on Instagram in August 2023.
At the premiere, Curtis shared more insight into what her hangs with Hargitay look like.
“We laugh a lot,” she told TODAY.com. “The f-word is dropped — a lot, and we both say, ‘Hold, please,’ a lot, like, a lot.”
“I’ve never met somebody else who says, ‘Hold, please,’ as much as I do,” she continued, even acting out an example by mimicking scrolling through a phone and saying, “Hold, please. Hold, please.”
“The two of us are like little parrots,” she added.
In December 2024, both women shared black-and-white pics of themselves posing together in matching black outfits, with Curtis sharing a message of support for Hargitay’s “secret project.”
In April, Curtis reflected on their friendship in another Instagram post, which featured a series of photos of the duo posing and laughing.

“The universe is funny. It kept my secret, matching glasses, soul sister, from me for a LONG TIME and then the connect the dots of family, home, marriage, children and careers which has taken us from strangers to comrades to sobbing babies to the hyenas we became within seconds of seeing each other,” she wrote, concluding the caption by expressing her excitement for “My Mom Jayne” and Hargitay’s “continued brilliance” as Olivia Benson on “SVU.”

title: Mark Hamill Addresses Speculation That He 'Quit' the 'Star Wars' Franchise
summary: Mark Hamill believes his time in the "Star Wars" universe has come to an end, but he does want to make one thing clear about his reported departure from the legendary franchise: he did not quit."Well, let me say: they haven’t asked me," he clarified in a preview clip from his upcoming Sunday Sitdown interview with Willie Geist.
story: Mark Hamill believes his time in the "Star Wars" universe has come to an end, but he does want to make one thing clear about his reported departure from the legendary franchise: he did not quit.
"Well, let me say: they haven’t asked me," he clarified in a preview clip from his upcoming Sunday Sitdown interview with Willie Geist. "It’s not like they said, ‘Please come back.’”
The 73-year-old actor, who portrayed the iconic Luke Skywalker in six "Star Wars" films, expanded upon recent comments that his time with the legendary sci-fi franchise is done.

"I don't want to make a big PR pronouncement like 'This is my decision,'" Hamill said. "I’m just saying that it really felt like a conclusion. My character was given complete closure. I died, ironically by overdosing on the Force, I might point out."

In the 2017 film "The Last Jedi," Skywalker dies at the end, melding with The Force. Hamill then makes another appearance as Skywalker's Force spirit in the 2019 sequel "The Rise of Skywalker." That film marked the seeming end of a character arc that began with a young Skywalker in the original "Star Wars" in 1977.

"Once the Skywalker trilogy was over, it was a whole new era for them," Hamill said. "(Creator) George (Lucas) gave them this amazing canvas, the entire galaxy. They can do Westerns, mysteries, comedies, whodunits, anything within that realm of 'Star Wars.' And they’re doing so well. I love 'Rogue One,' 'Mandalorian, 'Book of Boba Fett.'"
Hamill generated headlines and fan buzz about him officially being done with "Star Wars" when he told ComicBook.com on May 31 that he felt the story should move on without him.

"I am so grateful to George (Lucas) for letting me be a part of that back in the day, the humble days when George called 'Star Wars' '‘the most expensive low-budget movie ever made,’” Hamill told the site. "We never expected it to become a permanent franchise and a part of pop culture like that. But my deal is, I had my time. I’m appreciative of that, but I really think they should focus on the future and all the new characters.”
While Hamill is ready to close the book on his "Star Wars" chapter, he added that he has not turned down any subsequent appearances as Skywalker.
"I just think it’s time. I had my time," he told Willie. "I’m really appreciative, but I’m really looking to the future for all these new projects.

But I do know, when I mentioned anything about the space movies, it gets extra scrutiny, as opposed to me talking about anything else. I said that, and then I saw headlines, you know 'Mark Hamill Quit Star Wars.' Well, let me say: they haven’t asked me. It’s not like they said, 'Please come back.'"
There's also the fact that Skywalker died in "The Last Jedi."

"Yeah, exactly. I mean, come on. How much can you do when the Force goes?" Hamill said. "I’d like to see a movie set all in the Force ghost realm. You know, I could have conversations with (late Obi-Wan Kenobi actor) Alec Guinness and all."
"Oh, now you're giving them ideas," Willie joked.
The full Sunday Sitdown interview with Hamill will air on Sunday TODAY on June 15.

Meanwhile, Hamill's latest project, "The Life of Chuck," based on Stephen King’s 2020 novella of the same name, hit theaters on June 13. In the film, Hamill plays the grandfather of the title character, whose life is portrayed over the years by four different actors.
“It’s so positive. It’s so optimistic about life,” Hamill told TODAY.com. “It also teaches you there are moments that, in life, you think are trivial that collectively become very important.”

story: What we know
